full_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard v4.0
description: Global security standard for organizations that handle cardholder data, mandated by major card brands (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, JCB).

key_requirements.title: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls
key_requirements.description: Implement firewalls and network segmentation to protect cardholder data environment
requirements: Install and maintain network security controls (firewalls, routers)
Apply secure configurations to all system components
Segment cardholder data environment from other networks
Restrict connections between trusted and untrusted networks
Document and diagram all network flows and system connections

key_requirements.title: Apply Secure Configurations
key_requirements.description: Develop and maintain secure configurations for all system components
requirements: Change all vendor-supplied defaults before system deployment
Remove or disable unnecessary services, protocols, and accounts
Implement and maintain configuration standards for all components
Encrypt administrative access using strong cryptography
Maintain inventory of system components in scope

key_requirements.title: Protect Stored Account Data
key_requirements.description: Protect cardholder data through encryption and secure storage
requirements: Encrypt Primary Account Number (PAN) wherever stored
Never store sensitive authentication data after authorization
Mask PAN when displayed (show only first 6 and last 4 digits)
Render PAN unreadable using encryption, truncation, hashing
Document and implement data retention and disposal policies

key_requirements.title: Protect Cardholder Data in Transit
key_requirements.description: Encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open, public networks
requirements: Use strong cryptography (TLS 1.2 or higher) for transmission
Never send unprotected PANs via email, instant messaging, SMS
Ensure wireless networks transmitting cardholder data use encryption
Implement proper certificate management and validation
Use only trusted keys and certificates

key_requirements.title: Protect Systems Against Malware
key_requirements.description: Implement anti-malware solutions on all systems
requirements: Deploy anti-malware software on all systems commonly affected by malware
Ensure anti-malware mechanisms are kept current and active
Perform periodic malware scans
Generate and review anti-malware logs
Educate personnel on malware risks

key_requirements.title: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems
key_requirements.description: Identify security vulnerabilities and protect against known threats
requirements: Establish process to identify and rank security vulnerabilities
Install vendor-supplied security patches within one month
Deploy critical patches within regulatory timeframes
Develop applications based on secure coding guidelines
Conduct security assessments before production deployment

key_requirements.title: Restrict Access by Business Need-to-Know
key_requirements.description: Limit access to cardholder data to only those who need it
requirements: Limit access to system components and cardholder data to need-to-know
Assign access based on job classification and function
Implement default deny-all policy
Document and approve all access privileges
Review access rights at least every six months

key_requirements.title: Identify Users and Authenticate Access
key_requirements.description: Assign unique ID to each person with computer access
requirements: Assign unique ID to each user before allowing access
Implement multi-factor authentication for all access to CDE
Use strong authentication methods and encryption
Document and communicate authentication procedures
Implement account lockout after failed login attempts

key_requirements.title: Restrict Physical Access
key_requirements.description: Control physical access to cardholder data and systems
requirements: Use facility entry controls to limit physical access
Implement procedures to identify and authorize visitors
Secure all media containing cardholder data
Destroy media when no longer needed for business or legal reasons
Protect devices that capture payment card data

key_requirements.title: Log and Monitor All Access
key_requirements.description: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
requirements: Implement audit trails to link access to individual users
Log all actions taken by privileged users
Secure audit trail logs so they cannot be altered
Review logs daily for suspicious activity
Retain audit log history for at least one year

key_requirements.title: Test Security Systems Regularly
key_requirements.description: Regularly test security systems and processes
requirements: Perform quarterly internal and external vulnerability scans
Conduct annual penetration testing
Implement file integrity monitoring on critical files
Test security controls after any significant change
Use qualified security assessor or internal security team

key_requirements.title: Support Information Security with Policies
key_requirements.description: Maintain policy that addresses information security for all personnel
requirements: Establish, publish, and maintain security policy
Implement operational security procedures
Define security responsibilities for all personnel
Conduct security awareness training for all personnel
Screen potential employees prior to hire
Maintain incident response plan and test regularly

compliance_checklist: All vendor default passwords and settings changed
Cardholder data encrypted at rest using strong cryptography
Sensitive authentication data not stored post-authorization
TLS 1.2 or higher used for data transmission
Anti-malware software deployed and updated regularly
Security patches installed within required timeframes
Access to cardholder data restricted to business need-to-know
Unique user IDs assigned to all users
Multi-factor authentication implemented for CDE access
Physical access controls for data centers and systems
Incident response plan developed and tested

compliance_levels.Level 1: Merchants processing over 6 million transactions annually - Annual Report on Compliance (ROC) by QSA and quarterly network scans
compliance_levels.Level 2: Merchants processing 1-6 million transactions annually - Annual Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) and quarterly network scans
compliance_levels.Level 3: Merchants processing 20,000-1 million e-commerce transactions annually - Annual SAQ and quarterly network scans
compliance_levels.Level 4: Merchants processing fewer than 20,000 e-commerce transactions or up to 1 million other transactions - Annual SAQ and quarterly network scans (may be required by acquirer)

penalties.description: Non-compliance penalties imposed by card brands and acquiring banks:
examples: Card brand may terminate merchant account
Liability for fraud losses if data breach occurs

regulatory_bodies.name: PCI Security Standards Council
regulatory_bodies.role: Develops and maintains PCI DSS standards
